Row.Text: Old Men and the Sea
A band of local fishermen have appealed to the City for funding for a seasonal fishing expedition.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Choose from the following options...
Let's focus on something simple.
Spend {1_Scaled}. Gain {2_InstantYield} Food in the City.
A large investment will pay dividends.
Spend {1_Scaled}. Fishing Boats near the City will gain +5 [ICON_FOOD] Food for {5_Turns}.
I'd rather invest in something much more lucrative...
Invest {1_Scaled}. 33% chance for a Harbor to be constructed in the City.
The investment in {2_City} was successful and paid for construction!
Harbor Constructed!
Dramatic Masterpiece
Writers from the City have penned a new work, and critics are calling it a 'masterpiece'. News of this has reached your ear, and your advisors await your response.
Send news to the other civilizations of the world.
{1_YieldCost}. Gain {2_InstantYield} Tourism with all known Civilizations.
Let's celebrate this.
Gain {2_InstantYield}.
Make sure the writers are praised for this.
Gain {4_GPChange} points in the City.
They should have been praying instead.
Gain {2_InstantYield}.
Writers from {2_City} have penned a new dramatic work, attracting visitors from around the world.
Writers from {2_CityName} create a masterpiece.
Trouble at the Temple

Priests from the City demand that you weigh in on a religious debate. As the City grows, more and more people of different faiths are asking for use of the Temple. People of the majority faith resent this and threaten violence if you allow nonbelievers into the Temple. Nonbelievers, however, threaten to leave if you do not let them in. What will you do?
Drive the non-believers from the City!
-1 [ICON_CITIZEN] Population in the City, and 2 turns of [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance. Gain {2_InstantYield}.
Let the foreigners in, but make them pay for it.
Temple gains +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold and +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith. -1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness in City.
We must accept the nonbelievers as they are.
50% chance that the Temple is destroyed. If so, the city gains +1 [ICON_PEACE] Faith and +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness.
The nonbelievers in {2_City} struck out at the Temple, burning it to the ground in protest. Your people are not shaken, however. City receives +1 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness, and: {5_Help}
Temple in {2_City} destroyed!
We should think bigger.
{1_YieldCost}. The Temple is destroyed, and a Grand Temple is built in its place.
Beacon of Hope
Fishermen in the City are concerned about the fate of the City's Lighthouse. In recent years it has fallen under disrepair, and it needs to be rebuilt. How should we deal with this?
Let private citizens manage it.
Lighthouse gains +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
The city should manage it.
Lose {1_YieldCost}. The Lighthouse gains +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
Sell off the land.
Gain {2_InstantYield}. The Lighthouse is destroyed.
All For One

In the midsts of this war, there are rumours that your consort has not only been unfaithful, but is actively fraternising with the enemy![NEWLINE][NEWLINE] However, thanks to the combined efforts of the Crown's many agents, critical state secrets were kept from enemy hands! The mastermind of the plot? Your paramour!
The valour of my soldiers was instrumental in thwarting this plot. See to it they are given promotions befitting their deeds!
3 Musketeers are formed near the City.
It was only due to the presence of mind of my priests and advisors that the enemy agents were apprehended. Reward him with whatever he desires.
3 Inquisitors are formed near the City.
For these servants to renounce that traitor and bring this theft to our attention shows great patriotism and bravery! We should reward them with diplomatic appointments.
3 Envoys are formed near the City.
We must thank our secret agents who have proven that they were superior to those of the enemy.
When an enemy [ICON_SPY] Spy is killed receive [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age Points scaling with era and the level of the Spy killed.
All for One!
Receive [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age Points scaling with era and the level of the Spy for each enemy Spy killed.
A Notorious Pirate

My Liege, a notorious pirate is now known to spend his time ashore in one of our Harbor's taverns. His presence is attracting a slew of undiserables. So far, no one has been able to catch him.[NEWLINE]
Certainly no pirate I've ever heard of. Send some Navy official to deal with this. What's the worse that could happen?
This crackdown has some risk. There is a chance the Harbor could be destroyed.
Because of the attempt to round up pirates, rioters in {2_City} have burned the Harbor to the ground in protest and are terrorizing the City.
The Harbor in {2_City} has been destroyed!
I've heard much of this sailor's exploits. Send an agent to present him with this letter of marque.
Spend 1000 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to gain a Corvette.
Though the local fishermen may not like it, I can see the benefits of having a legendary tavern.
For {5_Turns}, the City's Harbor gains +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and +2 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism; however, nearby Fishing Boats lose 3 [ICON_FOOD] Food and 1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
Fireworks!
To celebrate the WLTKD, there was a huge firework display in {2_City} during the evening. Citizens came from far and wide to see it. Gain 2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness for {5_Turns}.
Harbor Trade

The local harbor is flourishing with trade and now foreign merchants are asking to establish a branch office here; however,we only have enough place for one of them. Which kind of merchants should we approve?
Merchants who bring new tools and studies are welcomed here!
Harbor provides +1 [ICON_RESEARCH] Science.
Merchants who bring in cultural artifacts and art are welcomed here!
Harbor provides +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.
Merchants who bring in treasures and riches are welcomed here!
Harbor provides +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold.
